instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b bad ram slots
threads.message: This board seems to be prone to bad ram slots. Got another one but this time both of the ram slots gone bad. Is any way to fix at least one of them? Or is any other trick to make it usable?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b bad ram slots
threads.message: Does it give 3 beeps or 1 beep?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b bad ram slots
threads.message:
Neither. It works but when you flex the motherboard especially where the ram slots are it freezes/image distorts. Especially when I push on one of the corner of ram slots. 
I tried re-flowing the ram slots at 300C. It did nothing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b bad ram slots
threads.message: Yeah, just forget about this one.
